results.title: The Big lift
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation and George Seaton
results.brief_description: Montgomery Clift and Paul Douglas star in this reenactment of the Berlin airlift of 1948 which occurred as a result of a Russian blockade of the western sector; refusing to allow the Allies to ship food supplies to starving Berliners. An airlift proves to be the only solution. Paul Douglas stars as ground operations sergeant Frank Kowalski, and Montgomery Clift as pilot Danny MacCullough, both of whom have differing views on the matter. Cornell Borchers features as a love interest.

results.title: The Big Lebowski
results.creator_credit: Ethan Coen, PolyGram Filmed Entertainment and Joel Coen
results.brief_description: The plot of this Raymond Chandleresque comedy-drama crime caper from the Coen Brothers pivots around a case of mistaken identity. Unemployed and laid-back, 70s refugee Jeff “The Dude” Lebowski likes hanging out with his friends and bowling. His life takes an alternate route when two thugs break into his home and soil his rug in the belief that they are accosting Jeff Lebowski, the Pasadena millionaire. The Dude looks up his wealthy namesake and manages to get a replacement for his soiled rug, but he also manages to embroil himself in a story of extortion, double-cross, deception, embezzlement, sex and dope. Cast includes Jeff Bridges, John Goodman, Julianne Moore, Steve Buscemi, Ben Gazzara and John Turturro.

results.title: The Big island [Italian version]
results.creator_credit: Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: The aim of this film is to show an international audience within a limited time span some attractive aspects of Australian life. Representing a brisk and exciting place and creating a mood of a country on the move. Cinematography by Keith Gow and Don McAlpine. Music by George Dreyfus. (Awards: AFI Travel Award 1970)

results.title: The Big hit [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Tri-Star Pictures, Warren Zide, Wesley Snipes and Che-Kirk Wong
results.brief_description: Mark Wahlberg stars as an anxiety ridden killer for hire who is part of an elite team of hitmen (made up of Lou Diamond Philips, Antonio Sabato Jr. and Bokeem Woodbine) in this violent action comedy. Wahlberg’s chaotic domestic life and stressful blood soaked professional life come unstuck when the kidnapping of a wealthy businessman’s daughter has major repercussions for the band of killers. From its fetishistic reconstruction of the code and conduct of organized crime, right down to its casual, flippant depictions of violence, “The Big hit” owes a lot to the films of Quentin Tarantino (which are in themselves pastiches of various European and American filmmakers). However the spectre of the Hong Kong action film hangs over them all (“The Big hit” goes as far as enlisting Hong Kong action director Che-Kirk Wong and the executive producer is the legendary John Woo), a cinema that is wonderfully inventive with its own form of genre splicing and indirect homage. Cast also includes Christina Applegate, Elliot Gould, Laine Kazan and Avery Brooks.

results.title: The Big gull: Karoro: New Zealand's black-backed gull
results.creator_credit: Derek Wright, New Zealand National Film Unit and Grant Foster
results.brief_description: The New Zealand black-backed gull is one of 44 species that has adapted its natural way of life, to benefit from the wasteful habits of man. With naturalist Sir Robert Falla.

results.title: The Big green disc
results.creator_credit: Phillip Nash, Media Design Interactive and Charlie Hemming
results.brief_description: An interactive documentary, this CD-ROM looks at the future of our planet through a discussion of the environmental issues threatening it and what every person can do to help. Problems investigated include; global warming, pollution, ozone layer depletion, acid rain and the potential solutions: recycling, alternative energy sources and conservation. After examining the issues, you can enter into the debate, hearing what the world’s experts have to say about the issues affecting us all. This beautifully composed CD-ROM is fully narrated with stunning photography throughout, it includes specially filmed video sequences, in-depth photo stories and animated diagrams, including graphs to illustrate relevant points. Also included is a full index of contact addresses for all the relevant environmental organisations in Europe and America. A very useful and interesting means of learning how we can all help to save our home, which would suit secondary school aged children and adults alike!
